p: EOs were extracted from the aerial parts of P. eldarica via hydrodistillation. The yields of the EOs obtained were 1.2 cm 3/100 g of dried needles, 0.7 cm 3/100 g of dried pollen, and 0.9 cm 3/100 g of dried bark ( Table 1). These very low yields were consistent with those obtained in previous studies conducted on other species within the genus Pinus [ 14]. Therefore, it seems that this tree is an EO-poor plant.
